#### About
Dana A. Kahn is a budding environmental scientist and musical advocate with a focus in geospatial analysis, field work, sustainability, and community engagement. She recently defended her master's thesis at Emory University in Atlanta, Georgia. Dana conducts environmental research on methane cycle processes in a nationally recognized Northern Forest for the [Sihi Biogeochemistry Laboratory](https://www.debjanisihi.com/) and [Woodwell Climate Research Center](https://www.woodwellclimate.org/project/methane-cycling-in-northern-forests/). Additionally, Dana has been involved in climate justice and environmental advocacy projects, most notably with the Partnership for Southern Equity and The Climate Reality Project.
